result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery T Kollatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Invoice

Defendant Jeffery T Kollatz in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the PSI was submitted to all parties.  Atty Selsing received a copy of the PSI and is prepared to proceed.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Selsing makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
Defendant is remaned into custody
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
Payment of court obligations and supervision fees
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by Department of Corrections
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
No use of any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician. Must use one physician and one pharmacy.
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Not eligible for Challange Incarceration Program

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on February 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffery T Kollatz in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee states that the parties are requesting a PSI and a sentencing date.  Atty Selsing agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in. 
PSI ordered
Set for Sentencing
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffery T Kollatz in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Selsing; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Selsing agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Selsing states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
Atty Selsing enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.

Defendant Jeffery T Kollatz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant still does not have counsel; however, in speaking with him before court the defendant would like to get one.  Defendant has to check into how much it would cost to get an Attorney.  Court questions public defender.  Defendant has not applied yet for PD appointment.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give defendant time to get an Attorney.

Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $2000 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
